subject: Re: [junit] Re: Hamcrest Type mismatch
msgSnippet: ... I don t see why actual is declared as Object? It looks like Hamcrest ... How about this example: JTable table = new JTable(); table.setValueAt( a
messageBody:
On 7/5/07, David Vydra <david@...> wrote:
>
> > Example:
> >
> > Object actual = "a string";
> > assertThat(actual, is("a string"));
> >




I don't see why 'actual' is declared as Object? It looks like Hamcrest
> is written correctly in this respect.
>

How about this example:

JTable table = new JTable();
table.setValueAt("a string", 0, 0);
assertThat(table.getValueAt(0, 0), is("a string"));
// getValueAt()'s return type is Object

?


--
Kevin
